ratings.comment: Jorge is my PI, so I conduct research for him. He is great, very funny, cares very much about your success. He is also very understanding and flexible.

Nice guy but not a good professor. Lectures are extremely vague and includes only pictures.  He's even more confusing in office hours. He expects you to know organic chemistry and biochem like he does. Lots of mechanisms and application. Test average was a 52. No curves, no extra credit. Avoid at all cost.

Not a bad person 1 on 1, but terrible email correspondence and doesn't allow you to see your test beyond his scheduled periods. Don't take this without taking ochem, and biochem would really help. Extraneous details detract from main focus, so it's on you to maintain it. Lowest class average of the 3 profs so don't fall behind.

I was worried about escalante from the other reviews before taking the class but was pleasantly surprised. His portion of the class will be MUCH easier if you are in/have taken BIOCHEM (not just chem 343!) His exam questions can be poorly worded but he tries really hard to clarify/answer questions and he is a really nice guy -- not bad if you study
Yeah, he is hard but you learn a lot. Plus he is a very nice man.

As he was going through lectures, he always stressed that he would focus on the main ideas of metabolism and structures but, when the exam came around it was details, details, details. Make sure you have taken chem 343 before taking this class with Dr. Escalante. If you do, about half of the material will be much easier. Make sure you don't cram.
Terrible lecturer.

Tests were insanely hard when there was no need for them to be.  Microbiology should not be a hard class when you've already taken bio, ochem, and biochem, but this class was impossible.  Avoid this class if you don't have to take it.  I made the mistake of taking it and it was a definite GPA buster...

His exams are incredibly tough. I could've studied hard for a month and not done any better than I did. (I did decently.) He is arrogant and will belittle you for asking "stupid" questions. Avoid if at all possible!!

Escalante gets a bad wrap 'cause he teaches the hardest section of Microbio 303. You need to remember ochem (redox rxns), but nothing super difficult. Lectures very detailed but exam encompasses 'the big picture.' Ask him for help if confused-go to discussion, he's very helpful. Don't be intimidated by his rep! He's a nice guy when one on one.

Very unclear lectures. Does not provide framework for what he intends students to be comfortable with. He points at pictures and talks for 75 minutes during lecture. Has no organization to teaching methods. 90% of learning will come on students' own terms, outside of class. Not very helpful or friendly. Required course, but avoid if possible.

Escalante was by far the worse professor I've encountered at this university so far. He teaches extreme amount of details, and is completely unclear about what he wants from the students. It was completely unhelpful to talk to him.

His section of the course was by far the worst. He was very rude and acted very arrogant. I felt like he was angry for having to teach us what he considered "basic chemistry," when, in reality, his pointless ramblings about reactions were quite hard because of the sheer number of them and his awful teaching skills. Top 3 worst professors I've had.
Terrible professor. First day of class he told our entire 8am lecture to grow up because we didn't ask what some word on the slide meant. Not to mention he lectures straight to biochem.
Jorge was the worst professor I've ever had. He taught me absolutely nothing. His section of the course was a waste of my time.

Jorge is condescending, rude, and arrogant. His lectures are unclear and poorly organized. I took Biochem 501 prior to Micro 303. Despite all of the amazing things microbes can do, Jorge focuses on THE SAME MATERIAL as biochem 501 - this class is a waste of time and money. Worst professor I've had in 4 years at UW - AVOID
He is very unclear, his lectures have little continuity. He does not follow the book at all. The majority of the material is only over chemical reactions. Take biochem first!

Horrible! He teaches this course at ~500 level, expecting you to know a ton of info that is impossible. Rarely followed the book so if you didn't understand the lecture -- forget it! He should really be teaching o-chem since that's his primary focus in this course. No practice exams! Haven't taken his exam yet, but I'm preparing for the worst!

Prof was arrogant, condescending, annoying, and taught us nothing. Exam was ridiculous, class avg being around 55/100. Expected way too much. Wasted lecture time yamming on about miscellanous organic chemistry. Textbook was not credible nor helpful. AVOID.
Absolutely awful-expected extensive use of o-chem, exam was horrible, expected people to know more than they should
